result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary A. Robl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-395, 15CM-120, 15CM-475, 15CT-162 and 15CM-425.

3:39 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea hearing today.

15CM-120: Defendant will plead to Count 1
15CT-162: Defendant will plead to charge 
15CF-395: State will dismissed and read in Count 1. Defendant will plead to Count 2 and 3 and 4
15CM-425: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in. 
15CM-475: Will be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes

Victim notice has been made and Ms. Firkus is in the courtroom.
Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM-120: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT-162: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-425: Count 1: NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-120: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CT-162: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-395: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-475: Dismissed and Read In

Due to time constraints, these cases will be adjourned for sentencing at another date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.
$2,500 sig bond: Comply with all other conditions of bond. No contact with Richard Sodke. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney  in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. Defendant Zachary A. Robl appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin.
P/NG entered.
BTC: $2,500 sig bond: Comply with all other conditions of bond. No contact with Richard Sodke.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
